name: Acorn Glass Pendant No. 9
description:
A little bit of whimsy for your neck. This glass acorn is flameworked in shades of pinks, reds and a touch of tan. It is then dotted with tiny bits of fine silver.  It measures 1-1/4" (31mm) from tip to tip (including the loop) and is 3/4" (19mm) in diameter.

The acorn cap is created by using a method called copper electroforming, which is essentially a process of using electricity and a special solution to adhere the copper to the glass.

It hangs from an 18 inch gunmetal chain with a 3 inch extender to adjust up to 21 inches. Wear it short, wear it long... it doesn't matter!

*** 
You are purchasing a unique work of art. I handcraft each glass acorn using a torch between 1200 and 1700 degrees. No acorn comes out the same way twice! When completed, the bead is then annealed in a digitally controlled kiln for strength and durability.

I try to accurately depict the color of my beads and jewelry, but all monitors are different. Please If you have any questions, you can send me a message and I will answer as promptly as possible. Have fun shopping!

name: Acorn Glass Pendant No. 17
description:
A little bit of whimsy for your neck. This glass acorn is flameworked in shades of transparent amber, purple and touch of steel blue. Slivers of dichroic shimmer in the center along with tiny dots of silver, then deeply encased in clear glass for a magnifying effect.  It measures 1-1/4" (31mm) from tip to tip (including the loop) and is 3/4" (19mm) in diameter.

The acorn cap is created by using a method called copper electroforming, which is essentially a process of using electricity and a special solution to adhere the copper to the glass.
